overview: Lance founded UrbanDaddy in 2005 as a luxury email newsletter for men, catering to luxury audiences overlooked by the emerging digital media industry. A pioneer in digital media, Lance has overseen the growth of UrbanDaddy into a multi-brand, multiplatform business which incorporates editorial, e-commerce, mobile and emerging digital experiences. Prior, Lance practiced at Willkie Farr & Gallagher, specializing in corporate law. He is currently an executive member of IADAS, was appointed to be one of the founding judges for the Webby Awards and was named a finalist for Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year Award in 2011. A native of California, Lance holds a summa cum laude bachelor’s degree in economics and philosophy from UCLA and a juris doctorate degree from Berkeley Law.

degrees.institution: University of California Berkeley Law School
